title: Contributing to bribeR
text: outlines propose change bribeR. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to bribeR
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to bribeR
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to bribeR
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("jessietrudeau/BribeR", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to bribeR
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to bribeR
text: Please note bribeR project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Introduction to BribeR
code: # Install the released version from CRAN (if available) install.packages("BribeR")  # Or install the development version from GitHub remotes::install_github("agsotopl/BribeR")

title: Introduction to BribeR
text: package currently includes 3 main functions: package also contains 3 support functions allow users access raw transcript data directly: Example: Note: get functions operate separately main functions, access raw data. main functions meant access compilation RDA’s. Example:
code: meta <- read_transcript_meta_data() head(meta, 6) transcript_5 <- get_transcripts_raw(n = 5, combine = FALSE, package = "bribeR")  head(transcript_1)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andres Soto Plaza. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Soto Plaza (2026). BribeR: Package Understanding Corruption Transcripts. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {BribeR: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts},   author = {Andres {Soto Plaza}},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts
text: BribeR distributes curated standardized transcript corpora integrated metadata political institutional research. datasets include structured transcript text, topic annotations, speaker identifiers formatted support reproducible qualitative, quantitative, network-based analysis. package provides convenient access transcript data Vladivideos corpus — collection secretly recorded conversations involving Vladimiro Montesinos, Peru’s former intelligence chief, document corruption, bribery, political manipulation Fujimori era.

title: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts
code: # When available on CRAN # install.packages("BribeR")  # For now, install the development version from GitHub # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("agsotopl/BribeR_Test_Site")

title: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts
text: package currently includes 3 main functions read explore transcript data: {BribeR} also includes 3 support functions allow users access raw transcript data directly: syntax {BribeR} functions follows consistent logic, making intuitive load dataset single line code.

title: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts
text: First, load library:
code: library(BribeR)

title: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts
text: read_transcripts() function loads pre-processed .rda files containing compiled transcript data. supports loading local file paths, remote URLs (e.g., GitHub raw links), installed package’s data/ directory. can also filter specific transcripts ID:
code: # Load the full Vladivideos transcript dataset all_transcripts <- read_transcripts("vladivideos_transcripts", package = "BribeR")  head(all_transcripts) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>       n row_id speaker         speech                              speaker_std #>   <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>           <chr>                               <chr> #> 1     1      1 Montesinos      Buenos días, tome asiento...        montesinos #> 2     1      2 Speaker 2       Gracias, doctor...                  speaker_2 #> ... # Retrieve only transcript 1 t1 <- read_transcripts("vladivideos_transcripts", package = "BribeR", transcripts = 1)  # Retrieve transcripts 5, 7, and 13 subset_transcripts <- read_transcripts(   "vladivideos_transcripts",   package = "BribeR",   transcripts = c(5, 7, 13) )

title: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts
text: read_transcript_meta_data() function builds tidy metadata table multiple source files, combining transcript descriptions, speaker rosters, topic annotations, word counts single tibble. row represents one transcript, : n: transcript identifier date: date associated transcript speakers: list-column unique, sorted speaker names n_words: total word count across speech turns topics: list-column topic labels derived topic flags
code: meta <- read_transcript_meta_data(   descriptions_path = "data-raw/Inventory & Descriptions/Descriptions.csv",   speakers_per_transcript_path = "data-raw/Inventory & Descriptions/speakers per transcript.csv",   transcripts_dir = "data-raw/transcripts",   recursive = TRUE )  head(meta) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   n     date       speakers   n_words topics #>   <chr> <chr>      <list>       <int> <list> #> 1 1     2000-01-15 <chr [3]>     1245 <chr [2]> #> 2 2     2000-01-20 <chr [2]>      893 <chr [1]> #> ...

title: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts
text: get family functions provides direct access underlying raw data:
code: # List all available transcript IDs ids <- get_transcript_id() ids #> [1]   1   2   3   5   7  12  13  19  ...  # Load a specific raw transcript t3 <- get_transcripts_raw(n = 3)  # Load multiple and combine into one tibble combined <- get_transcripts_raw(n = c(3, 19, 104), combine = TRUE) head(combined)  # Get the speaker roster per transcript speakers <- get_transcript_speakers() speakers #> # A tibble: … × 2 #>   n     speakers #>   <chr> <list> #> 1 1     <chr [3]> #> 2 2     <chr [2]> #> ...

title: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts
text: BribeR includes Shiny application visualizes relationships speakers topics across transcript corpus. app provides two network views: Speaker–Topic Network: connects speakers topics discussed transcripts Speaker Co-Appearance Network: connects speakers appear transcript Speakers color-coded type (e.g., Congress, Security, Judiciary, Media, Illicit) sized number transcripts appear . Hovering nodes reveals detailed metadata including speaker position, type, transcript count.
code: # Launch the interactive network app run_transcript_network_app()

title: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts
text: Transcript data loaded via read_transcripts() follows standardized structure: consistent format supports direct use standard tidyverse workflows text analysis, speaker comparison, corpus-level aggregation.

title: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts
text: use BribeR published research, please cite :
code: Soto Plaza, Andres (2025). BribeR: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts. R package version 0.0.0.9000. https://github.com/agsotopl/BribeR_Test_Site

title: Package for Understanding Corruption Transcripts
text: Original transcript data compiled standardized part research political corruption institutional accountability. Vladivideos corpus documents secretly recorded conversations central understanding corruption networks Peru’s Fujimori administration.

title: Retrieve Available Transcript IDs — get_transcript_id
text: function lists available transcript IDs (n values) based .csv files stored data-raw/transcripts folder BribeRdata package.

title: Retrieve Available Transcript IDs — get_transcript_id
code: get_transcript_id(package = "BribeRdata")

title: Retrieve Available Transcript IDs — get_transcript_id
text: package Character string naming package stores transcripts. Defaults "BribeRdata".

title: Retrieve Available Transcript IDs — get_transcript_id
text: numeric vector available transcript IDs.

title: Retrieve Available Transcript IDs — get_transcript_id
text: transcript named numerically (e.g., 1.csv, 19.csv, 104.csv), ID corresponds directly number. reference, see BribeRdata repository: https://github.com/jessietrudeau/BribeRdata/tree/main/data-raw/transcripts

title: Retrieve Available Transcript IDs — get_transcript_id
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Retrieve all available transcript IDs ids <- get_transcript_id()  # Use those IDs to load specific transcripts subset <- get_transcripts_raw(n = ids[1:3]) } # }

what: Get speakers present in each transcript — get_transcript_speakers
title: Get speakers present in each transcript — get_transcript_speakers
text: Reads canonical "speakers per transcript.csv" file returns one row per transcript n list-column unique speakers present transcript.

title: Get speakers present in each transcript — get_transcript_speakers
code: get_transcript_speakers(   path = file.path("data-raw", "Inventory & Descriptions", "speakers per transcript.csv") )

title: Get speakers present in each transcript — get_transcript_speakers
text: path Optional. Path speakers-per-transcript file. Defaults "data-raw/Inventory & Descriptions/speakers per transcript.csv".

title: Get speakers present in each transcript — get_transcript_speakers
text: tibble columns: n (character): transcript id speakers (list): unique, sorted character vector speakers transcript

title: Get speakers present in each transcript — get_transcript_speakers
code: # Load in all unique speakers in each transcript speakers <- get_transcript_speakers() #> Error: Speakers-per-transcript file not found at: data-raw/Inventory & Descriptions/speakers per transcript.csv

what: Retrieve Raw Transcript Files from bribeR — get_transcripts_raw
title: Retrieve Raw Transcript Files from bribeR — get_transcripts_raw
text: function retrieves one raw transcript .csv files data-raw/transcripts folder bribeR package. supports installed development versions package.

title: Retrieve Raw Transcript Files from bribeR — get_transcripts_raw
code: get_transcripts_raw(n = NULL, combine = FALSE, package = "bribeR")

title: Retrieve Raw Transcript Files from bribeR — get_transcripts_raw
text: n Optional integer vector integers specifying transcript(s) load. NULL (default), transcripts loaded. combine Logical; TRUE, combines transcripts single tibble added column n (transcript ID). Defaults FALSE. package Character string naming package stores transcripts. Defaults "bribeR". (Kept flexibility/testing.)

title: Retrieve Raw Transcript Files from bribeR — get_transcripts_raw
text: combine = FALSE, returns named list data frames (tibbles). combine = TRUE, returns combined tibble added column n.

title: Retrieve Raw Transcript Files from bribeR — get_transcripts_raw
text: Transcripts named numeric ID (e.g., 1.csv, 19.csv, 104.csv). can load transcripts specify subset transcript ID.

title: Retrieve Raw Transcript Files from bribeR — get_transcripts_raw
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load all transcripts (as a list) all_transcripts <- get_transcripts_raw()  # Load a specific transcript by ID t3 <- get_transcripts_raw(n = 3)  # Load multiple transcripts and combine them subset_combined <- get_transcripts_raw(   n = c(3, 19, 104),   combine = TRUE ) } # }

what: Read transcript-level metadata (n, date, speakers, duration, topics) — read_transcript_meta_data
title: Read transcript-level metadata (n, date, speakers, duration, topics) — read_transcript_meta_data
text: Builds tidy data frame transcript metadata three sources: Descriptions.csv (transcript identifiers, dates, topic flags), speakers_per_transcript.csv (speaker roster per transcript), finalized transcripts folder (word-count duration speech column).

title: Read transcript-level metadata (n, date, speakers, duration, topics) — read_transcript_meta_data
code: read_transcript_meta_data(   descriptions_path,   speakers_per_transcript_path,   transcripts_dir,   pattern = "\\.(csv|tsv)$",   recursive = FALSE,   quiet = TRUE )

title: Read transcript-level metadata (n, date, speakers, duration, topics) — read_transcript_meta_data
text: descriptions_path Character path Descriptions.csv containing least column n; ideally also date topic flag columns prefixed topic_. speakers_per_transcript_path Character path speakers_per_transcript.csv containing column n wide speaker columns named speakrer_std_# speaker_std_#. transcripts_dir Character path folder containing finalized transcript files (.csv/.tsv) speech column used word counts. Filenames (without extension) must match n Descriptions.csv. pattern Regex used match transcript files transcripts_dir. Default "\\.(csv|tsv)$". recursive Logical; search transcripts_dir subfolders. Default FALSE. quiet Logical; FALSE, prints progress messages. Default TRUE.

title: Read transcript-level metadata (n, date, speakers, duration, topics) — read_transcript_meta_data
text: tibble one row per transcript columns: n (character): transcript identifier (Descriptions.csv). date (character): date Descriptions.csv (NA absent). speakers (list character): unique, sorted vector speakers transcript. n_words (integer): total word count across transcript’s speech column (NA file found / lacks speech). topics (list character): vector topic names inferred topic_* flags.

title: Read transcript-level metadata (n, date, speakers, duration, topics) — read_transcript_meta_data
text: Transcript ID (n) date: Read Descriptions.csv. first column n identifies transcript; date taken -(coerced character). Topics (topics list-column): columns Descriptions.csv whose names start topic_ interpreted topic flags. topic considered present cell “truthy” (e.g., x/X, non-empty string, 1, TRUE). Topic names normalized removing topic_ prefix replacing _ spaces. Speakers (speakers list-column): Read speakers_per_transcript.csv. file expected store speakers wide form columns named like speakrer_std_1 (source misspelling accepted) speaker_std_1, ..._2, etc. collapsed unique, sorted character vector per transcript. Duration (n_words): matching transcript file exists transcripts_dir, function sums whitespace-delimited tokens across speech column produce total word count. transcript file matched basename (e.g., 12.csv 12.tsv corresponds n == "12"). file found, n_words NA.

title: Read transcript-level metadata (n, date, speakers, duration, topics) — read_transcript_meta_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ meta <- read_transcript_meta_data(    descriptions_path = "data-raw/Inventory & Descriptions/Descriptions.csv",    speakers_per_transcript_path = "data-raw/Inventory & Descriptions/speakers per transcript.csv",     transcripts_dir = "data-raw/transcripts",    recursive = TRUE     )  view(meta) } # }

what: Read and Optionally Filter a Transcript-Formatted RDA File — read_transcripts
title: Read and Optionally Filter a Transcript-Formatted RDA File — read_transcripts
text: function loads pre-processed .rda file containing compiled transcript data. supports loading : local file path computer, remote URL (e.g., GitHub raw link), installed package’s data/ directory (optional).

title: Read and Optionally Filter a Transcript-Formatted RDA File — read_transcripts
code: read_transcripts(path, package = NULL, transcripts = NULL)

title: Read and Optionally Filter a Transcript-Formatted RDA File — read_transcripts
text: path Character string specifying one : name .rda file within package (without extension), local file path .rda, URL (e.g., GitHub raw link) pointing .rda file. package Optional. Character string naming package containing RDA (loading package’s data/ directory). Defaults NULL. transcripts Optional numeric character vector specifying transcript IDs (n) filter. NULL, transcripts returned.

title: Read and Optionally Filter a Transcript-Formatted RDA File — read_transcripts
text: data frame (tibble) columns n, row_id, speaker, speech, speaker_std. transcripts specified, matching transcripts returned.

title: Read and Optionally Filter a Transcript-Formatted RDA File — read_transcripts
text: Optionally, users can specify one multiple transcript IDs (n) filter transcripts interest. filter provided, full dataset returned.

title: Read and Optionally Filter a Transcript-Formatted RDA File — read_transcripts
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # 1. Load the full dataset all_transcripts <- read_transcripts(   "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jessietrudeau/BribeRdata/main/data/vladivideos_transcripts.rda" )  # 2. Retrieve only transcript 1 t1 <- read_transcripts(   "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jessietrudeau/BribeRdata/main/data/vladivideos_transcripts.rda",   transcripts = 1 )  # 3. Retrieve transcripts 5, 7, and 13 subset_transcripts <- read_transcripts(   "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jessietrudeau/BribeRdata/main/data/vladivideos_transcripts.rda",   transcripts = c(5, 7, 13) ) } # }

what: Run the Transcript-Topic-Speaker Shiny app (fixed project paths) — run_transcript_network_app
title: Run the Transcript-Topic-Speaker Shiny app (fixed project paths) — run_transcript_network_app
text: Launch interactive Shiny application visualizes relationships speakers topics transcript collection, using fixed project-relative paths metadata transcripts.

title: Run the Transcript-Topic-Speaker Shiny app (fixed project paths) — run_transcript_network_app
code: run_transcript_network_app(transcript_dir = NULL)

title: Run the Transcript-Topic-Speaker Shiny app (fixed project paths) — run_transcript_network_app
text: transcript_dir Optional path directory transcript CSV/TSV files (speaker_std column). NULL, app use data-raw/transcripts current working directory.

title: Run the Transcript-Topic-Speaker Shiny app (fixed project paths) — run_transcript_network_app
text: shiny.appobj , printed, launches Transcript-Topic-Speaker Shiny application.

title: Run the Transcript-Topic-Speaker Shiny app (fixed project paths) — run_transcript_network_app
text: version assumes working directory set project root uses following fixed subdirectories: data-raw/Inventory & Descriptions : Descriptions.csv speakers per transcript.csv Topic Descriptions.csv Actors.csv data-raw/transcripts transcript CSV/TSV files inst/images/montesinos.PNG (optional image "montesinos" node) function expects metadata CSVs following structure: Descriptions.csv contains column n (transcript ID) multiple topic_... columns "x" indicating topic inclusion. speakers per transcript.csv contains column n wide-format speaker columns speaker names. Topic Descriptions.csv contains column topics column descriptions describing topic. Actors.csv contains information actors, including speaker, speaker_std, Type, Position. Transcript files data-raw/transcripts (transcript_dir) must contain speaker_std column used compute speaker frequency across conversations.

title: Run the Transcript-Topic-Speaker Shiny app (fixed project paths) — run_transcript_network_app
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Run using the default data-raw/ structure: run_transcript_network_app()  # Run using a custom transcript directory: run_transcript_network_app("other/transcripts/path") } # }
